intro: Notanthera ellipticus, commonly known as the narrowleaf notanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Notanthera ellipticus is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
